qas.question: Who was the leader of the group attacked by the people of the Marshall Islands in 1834?
In what year did missionaries arrive to live in the Marshall Islands?
On what island did the Missionaries live with citizens of the Marshall Islands?
Who was the captain of the crew killed in 1834?
In what year was the ship Naiad attacked by natives?
What type of ship was the Naiad?
Out of what city was the Sea Nymph sailing?
Where did missionaries live as of 1857?

context: A number of vessels visiting the islands were attacked and their crews killed. In 1834, <a0_0><a5_0>Captain DonSette<a5_0/><a0_0/> and his crew were killed. Similarly, in <a6_0>1845<a6_0/> the <a7_0>schooner<a7_0/> <a1_0>Naiad<a1_0/> punished a native for stealing with such violence that the natives attacked the ship. Later that year a whaler's boat crew were killed. In 1852 the <a8_0>San Francisco<a8_0/>-based ships <a2_0>Glencoe and Sea Nymph<a2_0/> were attacked and everyone aboard except for one crew member were killed. The violence was usually attributed as a response to the ill treatment of the natives in response to petty theft, which was a common practice. In <a3_0>1857<a3_0/>, two missionaries successfully settled on <a4_0><a9_0>Ebon<a9_0/><a4_0/>, living among the natives through at least 1870.:3
